alert.note: Alert for West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued May 03 at 3:24AM MDT until May 05 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 8 PM THURSDAY FOR PORTIONS OF CENTRAL AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FRIDAY FOR PORTIONS OF WESTERN, CENTRAL, AND EASTERN NM DUE TO STRONG WINDS, LOW HUMIDITY, AND AN UNSTABLE ATMOSPHERE... .Increasing southwest flow aloft will spread very dry air over the region Thursday and Friday. Strong southwest winds, very low humidity, warm temperatures, and an unstable airmass will lead to several hours of critical fire weather conditions across parts of the region. In addition, lightning strikes from today and Tuesday over receptive fuel beds may lead to new ignitions. ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY EVENING... The National Weather Service in Albuquerque has issued a Fire Weather Watch...which is in effect from Friday afternoon through Friday evening. * AREA AND TIMING...West Central Mountains (Zone 105) and West Central Basin and Range (Zone 109) from Friday afternoon through early Friday evening. * 20 FOOT WINDS...Southwest 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...6 to 10 percent. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Fire Weather Watch.

area.areaDesc: West Central Basin and Range; West Central Mountains
